snippet: Some of the animal sculptures in what is known as the hospital’s sobriety garden were smashed, and some lost their heads, but the culprit has not been found.
abstract: Animal sculptures at Bellevue Hospital Center's sobriety garden are smashed and destroyed by vandals; garden, which sits in a back corner of the hospital at Franklin D Roosevelt Drive and 26th Street in Manhattan, does not have a fence and is open to the public; hospital will clear the garden and reopen it this spring.
lead_paragraph: Some of the animal sculptures in what is known as the hospital’s sobriety garden were smashed, and some lost their heads, but the culprit has not been found.

headline.main: Sculptures Vandalized at Bellevue Hospital’s Serene Escape
headline.print_headline: Sculptures Vandalized at Hospital’s Serene Escape
